title: Autonomous Runtime Safety Policy
description: Defines live environment acceptable performance deviations triggering automated rollback (Post-Deployment Governance). This decouples real-time operational limits from pre-deployment confidence metrics. Includes specific safeguards for AGI autonomous evolution cycles.

latency_deviation_ms.description: Maximum acceptable sustained increase in 95th percentile request latency (in milliseconds) relative to pre-deployment baseline.

error_rate_threshold.description: Maximum acceptable sustained transaction error rate (e.g., 0.005 = 0.5% failure rate) relative to baseline.

memory_spike_limit_pct.description: Maximum percentage spike in allocated memory usage relative to the deployment baseline (measured over 5-minute window).

minimum_failure_duration_s.description: Minimum duration (seconds) required for metric deviation to persist before classifying the deployment as unstable and triggering general rollback.

autonomous_cycle_time_increase_pct.description: Maximum acceptable increase (%) in AGI Kernel's average autonomous evolution cycle time post-deployment (indicating internal degradation or logic bloat).

novelty_integration_rollback_delay_s.description: If a deployment includes a new /emergent capability, extend the minimum failure duration to allow for initial stabilization phase (seconds). This grants tolerance for novel solutions.
